Tidal power.Description: Tidal power is a type of renewable energy that harnesses the energy from tides.
Tidal power utilizes tidal barrages, which are large dams built across estuaries or bays to capture tidal energy.
Tidal power uses tidal turbines, which are similar to wind turbines but operate underwater to generate electricity from tidal currents.
Tidal power employs tidal lagoons, which are enclosed areas of the sea that capture and store tidal energy.
Tidal power harnesses tidal stream generators, which are underwater turbines that generate electricity from the flow of tidal currents.
Tidal power depends on the tidal range, which is the vertical difference between high tide and low tide.
Tidal power can have an impact on marine life due to the construction and operation of tidal energy projects.
Tidal power involves the conversion of tidal energy into usable electricity through various technologies.
Tidal power requires the construction of specialized power plants to convert tidal energy into electricity.
Tidal power assesses the potential of tidal energy resources in different locations to determine feasibility and viability.
